data.title: Closed, no longer open 2016
data.text: Closed down, not surprised. The food has been going downhill for a number of years. When the food was good, I enjoyed their back patio more than Alberto's front patio.

data.title: No thank you
data.text:
Looking for some good local Mexican food we thought we would try this place out. Well we did take out but it 5 min before the host came out to help us. The bar was loaded up but that was about it. We ordered simple things like tacos. 

What a mistake. I think for the three of us I paid over $50 for three taco dinners with an app which was all to go. Right, that's what I thought. Btw Taco Bell taste much better. Sad but so true. No thank you!!!

data.title: Lunch Pleasanton
data.text: Around noon we were downtown Pleasanton, Sunday, for a street antique fair. Wall to wall people, standing room only at all the Main Street restaurants. We found Fernando's just off Main Street. It's hard to truly evaluate the service since we were the only ones in the restaurant. The server was very friendly and attentive. We started with Jalapeño Poppers. Great!! Not overly spicy, but very flavorful. The Tostada salad was very good. Fresh ingredients and very tender pork. The Polo en Crema consisted of chunks of chicken, onions and sour cream. It was was very bland. I would no recommend this dish. The restaurant dining area definitely needs a makeover an update.  Look forward to trying some other specialties next time.

data.title: Great Family Resturant
data.text: While I normally do not like restaurant with young children, this restaurant is an exception.  For some reason, kids are so well behaved here.  Maybe that is because children are well catered to.  Within 5 minutes children have good nutritious munchies.

data.title: Good local hangout
data.text:
The bar area is large with space spilling over to the outside patio with heaters.
Drinks are good, but they do not give the free appetizers anymore, was a good draw!
Food is good, I eat in Mexico a lot so is a bit different, but a good local restaurant.

data.title: Best chicken nachos
data.text: How many times have you ordered chicken nachos and been disappointed?   Fernandos has consistently had the best I've ever had.   I love the hometown atmosphere and its always a great place for lunch!

data.title: YUMMY !!!!!   But lacking the Authentico tastes from Mexico!
data.text:
It was allright..but my mole enchiladas could have used a side of something?????????Kinda bland.....but service was AWESOME!

WE got there around one o'clock for lunch....maybe better service at or (hopefully at a later time?) 

food is yummy..my girlfriends got the tostada salad...they were stuffed!

OK...Because the service was stellar and the food,  maybe bot so much? Going to give these guys a three star!

BUT  do try them and see what you think,,, you defifinately   need to iterate non- spicy wishes!
I had the Mole Enchiladas...not the best Mole  have ever  eaten..but decent..I guess if you are craving mole....then this will do?  Really not.. :(

data.title: Smell is GoshAwful
data.text: This place needs to be torn down.  In a previous life it was used as a gathering place for tobacco addicts.  The stench is still dreadful.  It could have the best food in town and be free and it would still be awful.

data.title: Real mexican
data.text: My husbands favorite Mexican restaurant!   I love their sangria!  Always empty when we come in unless you go to the bar area.  You really should try this place though.

data.title: I like the refried beans
data.text: The food is ok, average, but I love the beans. They have a great included soup or a salad that are both unique and good.  The wait staff are good and keep you happy.  Located right off Main st in Pleasanton

data.title: sun spot
data.text: good food and a pleasant place to sit and watch the world pass by

data.title: Great Bar Area & Happy Hour
data.text:
My wife and I love Fernando's.  I want to qualify that statement though.  We love Fernando's for happy hour and hanging out in the bar area.  The restaurant area needs a little face lift. 

All that said, they have $1 taco Monday's and the tacos are fantastic.  Everyday they have happy hour with pitcher specials and great little appetizer plates.  My wife and I often get the chimichanguitas and mini nacho plate.  Fantastic!  

The bartender Manny is really nice and will treat you well.  If you want authentic Mexican for a great price, go to Fernando's.

data.title: Better than Alberto's
data.text: The food is ok. The service is ok. You get my drift. But, go hang in the bar out back and that's great, especially if the bartender named Manny is working. He makes the best drinks. Enough said.
